item.title: MindSparx Full-Size CNC
item.description:
Overview

Watch the video

This project shows how to build a full-size, powerful, and fast CNC machine for around €500. With smart component choices and an efficient design, it’s an achievable project for many DIY builders.

At around 18:15 in the video, the drive belt setup is explained:

  • Belt type: HTD 3M, 15 mm wide, steel core
  • Pulley: 15 teeth

Parts Mentioned in the Video

  • 7 m HTD 3M timing belt (15 mm wide)
  • Set of 3 timing belt pulleys (6.35 mm shaft, 15 teeth)

    Tip: You can choose pulleys with fewer or more teeth to adjust the gear ratio.

item.title: Root 3 CNC
item.description:
Overview

The Root 3 CNC is an open-source, belt-driven 3-axis machine and the successor to Root 2.1.
For videos and a general intro, see the DIY CNC Designs – Inspiration page.

Belts (BOM)

Source: Root CNC Wiki – BOM

  • HTD-3M timing belt (open-ended) — “3M HTD Belt”
    Pitch: 3 mm · Width: 9 mm · Length: as required (open belt for axes)
    Rule of thumb: order at least 2× Y-axis travel + 1× X-axis travel, plus 5–10% extra for tensioning.
